history.content: This is correct. As such, that's might be a hint that combining the DS major and CS minor is redundant and unnecessary.

children.subject: I suppose my main confusion is what is the meaning of overlap - does it imply courses that are being used for both the major and minor, or all courses that count for the major/minor?

I'm not sure I completely understand, however. Since the C&ID requirement for Data Science only requires two of those overlapping courses (for example, 168 and 188), can't the other two (161, 186, along with 160) be used for the minor? Even though 161 and 186 technically overlap they are not being used for the major.

history.content:
For the minor, along with all the lower-div pre-requisities, we have to take 3 upper-division courses, of which one can overlap with your major. For Data Science majors, there are a number of CS courses that satisfy the Computational, inferential, analytical depth. I wanted to clarify a possible course schedule to see if it fits the criteria:

  • CS 168 - overlap
  • CS 188 - overlap
  • CS 160
  • CS 161 - overlap
  • CS 186 - overlap

Since only one of those CS courses does not overlap (160), does this mean I would have to find at least one other CS course outside of that? It seems like because there are so many choices for the depth, it's hard to find CS courses for the minor that do not overlap with the DS major.
history.subject: CS minor question
